noun.description: Grass which grows on cultivated land or pasture after mowing or harvest; (also) coarse, tufted grass growing on wasteland, in ditches, etc. Also (as a count noun): a patch or tuft of such grass.

origin: Early 18th century; earliest use found in Edward Lisle (??1666–1722). Apparently from row + -et. Compare earlier roughet and rowty.
